definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: Then, in an instant, the moon went black.
sentences.chinese: 然後，在一瞬間，月亮變成了黑色。

sentences.english: When Rhaegal roared, a gout of yellow flame turned darkness into day for half a heartbeat.
sentences.chinese: 當雷哥怒吼時，一瞬間一股黃焰將黑暗變成白晝。

sentences.english: Then, in an instant, everything changed.
sentences.chinese: 但，所有事情改變在一瞬間。

sentences.english: For a moment, he withholds, mouth full of pause…
sentences.chinese: 一瞬間，他忍住口胤中的千言萬語。

sentences.english: He always comes rushing up at the last moment.
sentences.chinese: 他往往到最後的一瞬間才急忙趕來。

sentences.english: He rode the ferry over, and I knew him the moment I saw him.
sentences.chinese: 他乘坐了輪渡過來，當我看到他的一瞬間就認出了他。

sentences.english: A man's reputation may be sacrifice in a moment of ill-considered action.
sentences.chinese: 一個人的聲譽可能斷送在考慮欠周的那一瞬間。

sentences.english: You are a hologram, held together by infinite energy through all spaces (mind) in one instant.
sentences.chinese: 你就是一份全息圖，在一瞬間，穿過所有時空。

sentences.english: In that instant, the worries of my day at work fade away.
sentences.chinese: 在那一瞬間，一天的工作憂慮都消逝了。

sentences.english: Xiao li fly knife moment, KuangXiang into little eunuch.
sentences.chinese: 小李飛刀一瞬間，匡翔變成小太監。

sentences.english: In a split second the melon is vapourised.
Intuition is something that occurs in the moment, and if you are open to it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你接受直覺，那麼它就是在一瞬間發生的事情。

sentences.english: Rush out a bush for an instant, seem long in front at that squad.
sentences.chinese: 一瞬間衝出叢林，出現在那個小隊長面前。

sentences.english: The trolley car is a runaway thing and you're making a split second choice.
sentences.chinese: 電車已失控，而你必須在那一瞬間做出選擇。

sentences.english: The form is changed by time, the moment outgrows you.
sentences.chinese: 形態隨時間蛻變，那一瞬間蓋過於你。

sentences.english: Fine actors can reveal complex feelings in a flash.
sentences.chinese: 好的演員能在一瞬間表達複雜情感。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
a burst/a fit/a peal/a spell (period of time)
